segment.source: Access the touch interface in MMOS
segment.target: Access the touch interface in MMOS

segment.source: Access the touch interface in MMOS
segment.target: Access the touch interface in MMOS

segment.source: Access the touch interface in MMOS
segment.target: Access the touch interface in MMOS

segment.source: The touch controller output can be captured and used in MMOS with proper touch driver support.
segment.target: The touch controller output can be captured and used in MMOS with proper touch driver support.

segment.source: The touch interface sample illustrates how you can gather touch coordinates in MMOS to implement manufacturing tests.
segment.target: The touch interface sample illustrates how you can gather touch coordinates in MMOS to implement manufacturing tests.

segment.source: Touch sample requirements
segment.target: Touch sample requirements

segment.source: The sample code requires that the Microsoft.Input.TchHID.spkg package to be included in the image (either the Main OS or MMOS).
segment.target: The sample code requires that the Microsoft.Input.TchHID.spkg package to be included in the image (either the Main OS or MMOS).

segment.source: The Microsoft.Input.TchHID.spkg package includes tchhid.sys, which implements the CreateFile and Readfile functions used by the sample code.
segment.target: The Microsoft.Input.TchHID.spkg package includes tchhid.sys, which implements the CreateFile and Readfile functions used by the sample code.

segment.source: Touch sample code
segment.target: Touch sample code

segment.source: This sample user-mode application displays the touch coordinates received by the touch screen driver.
segment.target: This sample user-mode application displays the touch coordinates received by the touch screen driver.

segment.source: The sample app uses the CreateFile function to open an exclusive handle to the device to receive raw touch samples.
segment.target: The sample app uses the CreateFile function to open an exclusive handle to the device to receive raw touch samples.

segment.source: The device name "TouchRaw0" is exposed by tchhid.sys, the HID touch class driver provided by Microsoft and included in Microsoft.Input.TchHID.spkg.
segment.target: The device name "TouchRaw0" is exposed by tchhid.sys, the HID touch class driver provided by Microsoft and included in Microsoft.Input.TchHID.spkg.

segment.source: After the handle is successfully opened, the application loops until a touch contact point is received near the top-left corner of the screen.
segment.target: After the handle is successfully opened, the application loops until a touch contact point is received near the top-left corner of the screen.

segment.source: The application reads and displays the coordinates and the associated touch contact ID.
segment.target: The application reads and displays the coordinates and the associated touch contact ID.

segment.source: The application uses the TouchInfo and TouchContact data structures, which are defined in %WPDKCONTENTROOT%includeumWinPhoneInput.h.
segment.target: The application uses the TouchInfo and TouchContact data structures, which are defined in %WPDKCONTENTROOT%includeumWinPhoneInput.h.

segment.source: The header code is shown here.
segment.target: The header code is shown here.

segment.source: Building and deploying the sample application
segment.target: Building and deploying the sample application

segment.source: To build the user-mode test application, complete the following steps.
segment.target: To build the user-mode test application, complete the following steps.

segment.source: Create a new user-mode application project in Visual Studio.
segment.target: Create a new user-mode application project in Visual Studio.

segment.source: For more info, see Develop MMOS test applications
segment.target: For more info, see Develop MMOS test applications

segment.source: Add the sample code and the header file to the project.
segment.target: Add the sample code and the header file to the project.

segment.source: Build the solution, ensuring that it is generated successfully.
segment.target: Build the solution, ensuring that it is generated successfully.

segment.source: Disable code integrity in MMOS, or sign the test executable.
segment.target: Disable code integrity in MMOS, or sign the test executable.

segment.source: For more info, see "Security in MMOS," in Develop MMOS test applications.
segment.target: For more info, see "Security in MMOS," in Develop MMOS test applications.

segment.source: Deploy the executable to the device and run the application.
segment.target: Deploy the executable to the device and run the application.

segment.source: For more information, see Deploy and test a user-mode test application in MMOS.
segment.target: For more information, see Deploy and test a user-mode test application in MMOS.
